TopicTitle: I really have no idea what I made!

Articles.Content:
<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/keLO3woTVwg?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

![lLpwsEm.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/lLpwsEm.jpg)  
  
It rotates but the Kerbal doesn't. It's got weird steering. There must be a use but I'm struggling to think what it might be.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-07T18:03:31Z" title="03/07/2015 06:03  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 7, 2015</time> by Foxster**

LOL, you should turn this into a combine harvester!

![_54492372_shirleynichollroevalley..jpg](http://news.bbcimg.co.uk/media/images/54492000/jpg/_54492372_shirleynichollroevalley..jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-07T20:52:24Z" title="03/07/2015 08:52  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 7, 2015</time> by Majorjim**
It's basicly a monowheel. Not sure what use it would have other then for something like a gyro stabolized cockpit for a fancy starship.

> 
> It's basicly a monowheel. Not sure what use it would have other then for something like a gyro stabolized cockpit for a fancy starship.

> 
> monowheel.

I know what I'm making today! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Awesome!

Now take it to the moon
I'm not sure it can handle rougher terrain. It looks great, but I wouldn't dare going uphill.

It can handle anything, cicatrix. This style of building is the strongest in KSP.

- - - Updated - - -

Foxster, I love this! Essentially this is my coaxial rotor system running free :-)

Of course, I can stick half of it on its side and teach my Kerbals how to vomit...

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/VMWse2cSMWc?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-07T23:13:03Z" title="03/07/2015 11:13  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 7, 2015</time> by Foxster**

1/3 of a gyro mechanism?

The only way to know for sure is to put it on Mun ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

On the Mun as requested...

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/0lxslbl409c?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Just had an idea...As the inner craft is always upright I could put an ion engine on top and push the whole thing down onto the surface...\*Goes away to play in the SPH\*

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-08T01:56:35Z" title="03/08/2015 01:56  AM" data-short="9 yr">March 8, 2015</time> by Foxster**
ok, now that is funny to see. Farming the moon anyone?

Well, here it is with an ion engine pushing the machine down onto the surface of the Mun...

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/we24IueiO4A?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Certainly tends to make it more sticky.

Now if I could just make this gimbal much, much smaller...
